Cool idea, David! Interested to see how this one is shaped!
Sean Diehl submitted a post about de-stigmatizing the protective garments--this is an idea re: how to do that and engage more people (especially students) around the world.

description: If getting protective clothing is critical, engage communities/schools/recreationg groups to take boring, white protective clothing and decorate it in an appealing way.  There could be a contest in school art classes for designs that are more likely to be worn. It could also be an educational opportunity to learn more about African culture and design.  Rather than designs that mimic North American culture, there could be some video (or print) materials that describe the different cultures in each country where Ebola is found.  The challenge would be to create great designs, and paint them on the protective clothing to be sent to Africa.  There could be designs for teenagers, adults, senriors, etc.
summary: Engage various international communities to "customize" protective clothing that will reduce the stigma of being ill (or trying to avoid becoming ill.
title: Custom Protection Garments
